metadata_frame: The following passage comes from The Barrys, a novel published in 1898 by Shan F. Bullock, an Irish writer.
main_question:
Never before had she been happier in this world; never felt before in her life as she had felt that day. Think of it all! From first to last she remembered everything, had but to close her eyes to see everything. And Ted had spoilt it all! She had done no harm, no harm. Why had he been so foolish? [masked sentence describing a cause or reason] Did he make love to ye?

answer_strings: 'Twas jealousy.
It was generosity.
Was it because of the old days, the old happenings?
He had seen her talking to another man.
Because he had fallen for another.

But the poor must earn their bread be the sweat o' their brow. Ay, ay." [masked sentence describing an inference or effect] All hurried down to the pier; there manned the big ferry cot and, Nan and

Bless his heart, he shall grow up a credit to the name. The best of everything he'll have, the best I can give him. That is my object in life now.
